definition: to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with
right/correct/couple/pair/towards/at/for/to face/opposite/to treat (sb a certain way)/to match together/to adjust/to fit/to suit/to answer/to reply/classifier: couple

sentences.english: It is imperative, therefore, that they use whatever resources are available and so should be segregated.
sentences.chinese: 因此，必須讓其使用任何可用的資源，並應對其隔離。

sentences.english: There should definitely be no data formatting or parsing of non-standard formats.
sentences.chinese: 絕對不應對非標準格式進行數據格式化或解析。

sentences.english: Objective To explore the relationship between post-stroke depression and social sustain and coping style with an aim to guide the prospective psychological intervention.
sentences.chinese: 目的探討腦卒中後抑鬱與社會支持及應對方式的關係。

sentences.english: The Works shall be measured, and valued for payment, in accordance with this Clause.
sentences.chinese: 應對工程依據本款進行測量並確定其支付價值。

sentences.english: You’ll feel successful and presentable and ready to tackle the world.
sentences.chinese: 您會感覺很成功，也很象樣，並且準備好去應對世界。

sentences.english: Li emphasized that cooperation is an effective tool to cope with the challenges faced by mankind.
sentences.chinese: 李肇星強調，合作是應對人類共同挑戰的有效途徑。

sentences.english: We need a plan to deal with grid failures.
sentences.chinese: 我們需要應對電網故障的預案。

sentences.english: When nonconforming product is corrected it shall be subject to re-verification to demonstrate conformity to the requirements.
sentences.chinese: 應對糾正後的產品再次進行驗證，以證實符合要求。

sentences.english: And what should countries do to prepare for more intense droughts and storms?
sentences.chinese: 國家應該怎樣爲應對更嚴峻的乾旱和風暴做好準備？

sentences.english: I'm not too sure there are many other teams who could possibly have coped with such a debilitating injury list.
sentences.chinese: 我不確定還有哪支球隊能應對如此大規模的傷病。

sentences.english: He also said that if a similar incident occurs in the future, Japan will resolutely deal with it.
sentences.chinese: 今後如再次出現類似情況，日方將繼續毅然應對。

sentences.english: Cater to their needs, and be prepared to handle every imaginable mistake.
sentences.chinese: 要迎合他們的口味，準備應對每一個想象得到的錯誤。

sentences.english: So how can you be best prepared for this adventure?
sentences.chinese: 那麼你怎樣才能最好的應對這種冒險經歷呢？

sentences.english: You may not be able to control the times, but you can compose your response.
sentences.chinese: 你也許不能控制時勢，可是你能夠冷靜應對。

sentences.english: In the teaching process of British-American Literature, the students should also be morally educated.
sentences.chinese: 在英美文學的教學過程中，應對學生進行德育教育。

sentences.english: Objective To investigate postgraduates ' coping styles within deferent extent of stress.
sentences.chinese: 目的研究不同程度的心理壓力下研究生的應對方式。

definition: to respond accordingly to/to adapt to/to cope with
to be on guard/wariness/to guard against/preventive
to handle/to treat/to deal with/to process/to deal with a criminal case/to mete out punishment/to offer for sale at a reduced price/to punish
timely/apt to the occasion/in due course
to meet a contingency/to adapt oneself to changes
to target/to focus on/to be aimed at or against/in response to
